Hi Kent,

On 2/21/07, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:

> I find that=
 static methods are easy to move around but more difficult to decompose. If=
 I see a complicated static method I look first at the parameter list to se=
e if there is a natural home for the method. If not, I consider making a me=
thod object (cf Implementation Patterns), converting the parameters to fiel=
ds, and then extracting parameterless helper methods (ibid).

Yes, I tend t=
o do the same.  The fact that static methods are less
coupled to my code th=
an instance ones is still overshadowed by the
fact that they are harder to =
test (or to be more precise:  code that
uses these static methods is harder=
 to test).

-- 
C=E9dric
